show.title: Pretty in Pink
show.headline: From Duckies to Blanes, all are welcome to join us to this John Hughes comedy

event.title: <show-title>Pretty in Pink</show-title> <event-type-title>Brunch</event-type-title>
event.headline: From Duckies to Blanes, all can join us in the best meal of the day – brunch
event.description:
Order from our tasty brunch menu – Egg BLT, French Toast, or Breakfast Tacos – and pair with a brunch cocktail classic like Desert Spring Water or the Italian 75. Each are available to order along with our full menu at this special brunch screening.

As far as we’re concerned, PRETTY IN PINK is the definitive guide to the classification of high school boys. Sure, fashion and hairstyles have changed (was Andrew McCarthy's hair ever cool?), but the universal truth of the film remains: if you're a teenage dude, you're either a Duckie or a Blane.

The Duckies of the world are typically adorable and goofy, but they're just never gonna make it out of the friend zone. The Blanes, on the other hand, were born to be hot and popular, so of course they take everything for granted and don't appreciate the awesome, amazing girls right in front of them. In other words, dating in high school sucks.

Fortunately, PRETTY IN PINK channels that suckage through Molly Ringwald, light of our lives, and wraps it all up in a fabulous '80s package. The music! Iona's wardrobe! Iona's hair! James Spader! The prom dress! Ok, well, not so much the prom dress.

Slip on your finest pink ensemble (bonus points if you sew it yourself) and start practicing your Otis Redding lip synch routine now!

show.title: Grease
show.headline: Summer lovin' lives on in this quintessential movie musical celebrating the '50s

event.title: <show-title>Grease</show-title> <event-type-title>SING-ALONG MOVIE PARTY</event-type-title>
event.headline: Rock and roll is here to stay at the GREASE Sing-Along
event.description:
We’re hopelessly devoted to GREASE, with its lovable characters, its doo-wop style, and, of course, those endlessly catchy tunes. To celebrate this timeless classic, we’re putting together an interactive, prop-filled, hand-jiving Sing-Along for all you T-Birds and Pink Ladies out there (beauty school dropouts also welcome).

We’ll kick things off with a pre-show hand jive contest before we start the interactive show, where you’ll have some candy cigarettes to help you look like a greaser, a comb so that you can comb-along to the action, ribbons, salon caps, and more. And because this is a Sing-Along, we’ll have the lyrics up onscreen to help every Danny, Sandy, Rizzo, and Kenickie in the audience get in on the fun.

So roll up the cuffs on those jeans, grab your respective black leather and pink satin jackets, theatrically comb your hair, and cruise on down to join us for the most rockin’ Sing-Along ever.

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Grease Sing Along Web SHOW Hero 1920x1080 v3

posterImage.altText: Grease Sing Along Web SHOW P 960x1400

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
We’re hopelessly devoted to GREASE, with its lovable characters, its doo-wop style, and, of course, those endlessly catchy tunes. To celebrate this timeless classic, we’re putting together an interactive, prop-filled, hand-jiving Sing-Along for all you T-Birds and Pink Ladies out there (beauty school dropouts also welcome).

We’ll kick things off with a pre-show hand jive contest before we start the interactive show, where you’ll have some candy cigarettes to help you look like a greaser, a comb so that you can comb-along to the action, ribbons, salon caps, and more. And because this is a Sing-Along, we’ll have the lyrics up onscreen to help every Danny, Sandy, Rizzo, and Kenickie in the audience get in on the fun.

So roll up the cuffs on those jeans, grab your respective black leather and pink satin jackets, theatrically comb your hair, and cruise on down to join us for the most rockin’ Sing-Along ever.

Tell you more? Order from our limited-time XOXO, Alamo menu, which includes the Eat Your Heart Out Pizza. Inspired by GREASE, it's a dreamy pie topped with marinated artichoke hearts, baby spinach, roasted garlic, mozzarella, and parmesan. It’s the one that you want. Available for a limited time at all screenings from 2/9 - 2/24.

show.title: The Phantom of the Opera (2004)
show.headline: The classic musical comes to life on the big screen

landscapeHeroImage.altText: PHANTOM OF THE OPERA HERO IMAGE

portraitHeroImage.altText: PHANTOM OF THE OPERA EC Portrait Image

event.title: <show-title>The Phantom of the Opera (2004)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wear the mask and sing the songs at this interactive epic
event.description:
Take BATMAN & ROBIN director Joel Schumacher, add in CATS scribe Andrew Lloyd Webber, throw in a huge dose of opera (with just a dash of Minnie Driver), and you’ve got yourself some grand campy goodness.

Join us for THE PHANTOM OF THE OPERA Movie Party, a musical extravaganza that’ll throw its magical lasso around you and never let go. We’ll have lighters to illuminate the chandelier scene, roses to celebrate Christine, and, of course, your very own Phantom mask. All we ask of you is that you and your friends come ready to belt out some opera (we're sure you'll sound molto bene) as we revel in the music of the night.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

The assisted listening headset provides an amplified audio signal for those individuals who are hard of hearing. A 3.5mm headphone jack is available to drive hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants.
You may not enter a movie after it has started. If you show up to your desired screening late, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or for a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.title: 2D Digital
formats.headline: Digital format projected using a digital projector.
formats.description: Digital format projected using a digital projector.

formats.title: 35mm
formats.headline: Film print projected using film projectors.
formats.description: The industry standard for theatrical film releases prior to digital cinema. Film print projected using film projectors.

agePolicies.name: All Ages
agePolicies.description: All ages including babies are welcome with parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: !!DO NOT USE!! Standard (1701)
agePolicies.description:
Children ages 3+ admitted before 6pm.
Children ages 6+ admitted after 6pm.
All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult.

agePolicies.name: Rated G
agePolicies.description: Guests under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children 3 and up allowed for shows that start before 6pm. Ages 6 and up after 6pm.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG
agePolicies.description: Guests under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children 3 and up allowed for shows that start before 6pm. Ages 6 and up after 6pm.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG-13 (Standard) (1701)
agePolicies.description: 18 and up. Guests ages 6-17 are welcome any time with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG with Adult Focus (1701)
agePolicies.description: 18 and up. Guests ages 6-17 are welcome any time with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: Rated R (1701)
agePolicies.description: 18 and up. Guests ages 6-17 are welcome any time with a parent or guardian.
